intro: Pasania uraiana, commonly known as the Uraiana pasania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
